shortdesc.ph: The information about the external encoded video frame.

p.codeblock: export class EncodedVideoFrameInfo { codecType?: VideoCodecType width?: number height?: number framesPerSecond?: number frameType?: VideoFrameType rotation?: VideoOrientation trackId?: number renderTimeMs?: number internalSendTs?: number uid?: number streamType?: VideoStreamType }

plentry.pd: The codec type of the local video stream. See . The default value is (2).

The codec type of the video:
1: VP8.
2: (Default) H264.
5: VP9.
The width (pixel) of the video frame.
The height (pixel) of the video frame.

pd.p: The number of video frames per second.
When this parameter is not 0, you can use it to calculate the Unix timestamp of the external encoded video frames.

pd.props: ios mac cpp unity electron rn flutter

plentry.pd:
The video frame type:
0: (Default) , blank frame.
3: , keyframe.
4:, the Delta frame.
5:, the B frame
6: , unknown frame

pd.props: ios mac cpp unity electron rn flutter

plentry.pd: The rotation information of the video frame, see .

Rotation information of the video frame, as the following:
0: (Default) 0 degree.
90: 90 degrees.
180: 180 degrees.
270: 270 degrees.
The track ID. Used in scenarios with multiple video tracks in the channel.
The Unix timestamp (ms) for capturing the external encoded video frames.
The Unix timestamp (ms) for rendering the external encoded video frames.
The user ID to push the the external encoded video frame.

ph.props: ios mac cpp unity electron rn flutter

ul.li: (0): High-quality stream, that is, a high-resolution and high-bitrate video stream.
(1): Low-quality stream, that is, a low-resolution and low-bitrate video stream.
